item.title: Meetings, menu bars, and focus modes
item.description: We recently moved all our issue tracking at work from GitHub Issues to Linear for one of the products that I work on.

item.title: pgBackRest 2.08 and macOS Mojave
item.description: UPDATE: My reasoning was incorrect below. It wasnâ€™t the moving of some of the lock code to C that caused the issue.

item.title: pgBackRest 2.07 and macOS Mojave
item.description: pgBackRest 2.07 was announced today. As usual, I immediately downloaded it and tried to get it up and running on my MacBook (currently running Mojave).

item.title: updated PostgreSQL homebrew script
item.description: With the release of PostgreSQL 10, I’ve updated my pg script.

item.title: Installing pgBackRest on OSX
item.description: If you’ve followed my previous posts (here and here), then you already have one or more versions of PostgreSQL installed on your Mac.

item.title: Managing multiple PostgreSQL installs via Homebrew
item.description: Following on from this post, you probably have multiple versions of PostgreSQL installed on your Mac.

item.title: Routing email through GMail on OSX
item.description: Like most geeks, I have scripts that I’ve written that I like to have run from cron on a regular basis.

item.title: Getting fancy with PostgreSQL and Homebrew
item.description: In our previous post, we installed PostgreSQL via Homebrew and got our own little cluster up and running under our userid.

item.title: PostgreSQL, Homebrew, and You
item.description: If you need to install PostgreSQL onto your Macbook, you have several options available to you nowadays.

item.title: Glutton for Punishment
item.description: I recently got a new Macbook Pro from work as my old one was having keyboard issues and since it was 3+ yrs old they deemed it not worth fixing.
